item.title: Implementing an LRU Cache in Rust
item.description: This post assumes familiarity with traits in Rust. If you arenâ€™t familiar with them, Iâ€™d recommend reading more about them. The [chapter][traits-chapter] in the official Rust book is as good a place as any ðŸ™‚ LRU caches are one of my favorite data structures to teach. One way of implementing an LRU cache (in Python, the language that I teach in) requires combining two separate data structures: a hash map in order to enable efficient access via hashing of keys, and a doubly-linked list in order to maintain the ordering of cache elements.
